result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary D. Alt

defendant.name: Alt, Gary D.
defendant.address: 306 E. Exchange St., Lone Rock, WI 53556

records.addlTxt:
1:02 PM Defendant Gary D. Alt in court.  Attorney Karl M. Gebhard III in court for Gary D. Alt.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gebhard provides the court with a preliminary hearing waiver. State indicates that they have provided an offer. Court goes over the preliminary hearing waiver with the defendant. Court binds over for trial. State brings forth the same charges that are listed on the criminal complaint.. Attorney Gebhard asks for a states close to January 1st.

Attorney Gebhard waives the formal reading of the information and enters a NG plea. 

Court sets that she would like to set this for trial. State indicates that this would be a one day trial. 

Substantive motion must be filed by 01/18/23.
Final status/scheduling conference scheduled for February 15, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury selection scheduled for March 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury selection on March 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on February 15, 2023 at 10:00 am.

1:35 PM Defendant Gary D. Alt in court.  Attorney Karl M. Gebhard III in court for Gary D. Alt. Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense has not received the complaint. Court states the charges and informs Def of the max. penalties as well as his rights including right to counsel. Prelim set. DA notes State's objection to authorization on file as this is a felony case. Court states Def is required to appear at all hearings.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 005322,
Payable Number: 66723,
Receipt Number: 22R 003592,
Amount: $20.00

1:02 PM Defendant Gary Alt appeared by video, in custody. State appears by Attorney Harper. Attorney Orth appears by video for this hearing only. GA has retain Attorney Mays in another case but not yet for this case.

State asks for a $2,500 cash bond 
No contact with keg and kettle.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 
No contact with CS or his residence.

Attorney Orth heard and request a signature bond and asks that the testing be eliminated.

Response from Attorney Harper.

Court orders:
$500 cash bond 
No contact with Keg and Kettle Bar. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, at a reasonable request by law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 
No contact with CS or his residence.
